title: What are the differences between a creative mind and an analytical mind? - Quora

response.answer_text: Although the greatest accomplishments in either field of activity require both, they are fundamentally almost opposite in nature. Analysis versus synthesis. Analysis means ‘taking apart’ and depends especially on conscious discriminating judgment and methodical activity. Creativity is a kind of synthesis — seeing things as related which may not be related in any literal or analytic sense; therefore creativity requires suspending analysis — at least in the phase of inspiration — and analysis requires suspending creativity — at least in the crucial phase of making distinctions and classifying things. In other phases of activity, they can improve each other’s results. For example, after you compose an inspired melody, it is helpful to figure out what time signature and key you’re written it in if you want to finish developing it into a fuller piece of music. Or after you analyze a problem, if you then allow yourslf to chew on it non-verbally (sub-conscious incubation), the results of your analysis may provide the groundwork for a creative insight (e.g. the ‘discovery’ of the benzene ring).
